alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Louisa; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 10:42AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rock Island, northern Mercer, Whiteside, northwestern Henry, northwestern Bureau, central Louisa, Scott, eastern Muscatine and southeastern Clinton Counties through 1145 AM CDT... At 1041 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Clinton to near Eliza. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Camanche, Albany and Low Moor around 1045 AM CDT. Clinton, Fulton and East Clinton around 1050 AM CDT. Garden Plain around 1055 AM CDT. Millersburg around 1100 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Morrison, Aledo, Hamlet, Reynolds, Matherville, Lyndon, Shale City, Viola and Boden. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 281 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 24. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 32. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 42. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
